result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle Marie Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to meet with the payment clerk on costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danielle Marie Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE called to request ext for her June pymt.  DE approved to make her June pymt by 4:30 pm on 6-21-16. jaf
c: Def, Atty, DA & SCSO. eif
DE appeared to add 15CM468 to current PPA.  DE to pay $30/mo comm 10-18-15.  $10 PPF added.  DE signed PPA. Includes 15TR3070, 15CM468. jaf

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Danielle Marie Harris appeared.  Court called at 9:58 a.m.  Set for PTC.  There is an agreement.  Attorney Kucinski recites the agreement.   State moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misdemeanor Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to the amended Ct 1.  Court reviews the police report.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1 Misdemeanor Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- Court suspends the fine and orders Court Costs of $243.00 and $200.00 for DNA surcharge.
- DE to meet with the payment clerk for a payment plan
- 20 days to appeal
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Kucinski. km

Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: EJL, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Danielle Marie Harris appeared. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 09:45 am.
